span.title: dateTime Type: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a UTC offset SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

tr.td: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: EHDS refined base model for a specimen to be used for Analysis

short.value: Specimen model

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for a specimen to be used for Analysis

short.value: An identifier of the specimen which is unique within in a defined scope. Example: identifier assigned by ordering system, identifier assigned by laboratory etc. Multiple identifiers can be used.

definition.value: An identifier of the specimen which is unique within in a defined scope. Example: identifier assigned by ordering system, identifier assigned by laboratory etc. Multiple identifiers can be used.

short.value: Availability of the specimen.

definition.value: Availability of the specimen.

short.value: The kind of material that forms the Specimen.

definition.value: The kind of material that forms the Specimen.

short.value: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance, a biologically-derived product, or a device

definition.value: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance, a biologically-derived product, or a device

short.value: Specimen from which this specimen originated

definition.value: Specimen from which this specimen originated

short.value: Why the specimen ws collected

definition.value: Why the specimen ws collected

short.value: This element signifies if the specimen is part of a group or pooled.

definition.value: This element signifies if the specimen is part of a group or pooled.

short.value: Collection details

definition.value: Collection details

short.value: Person or organisation who collected the specimen

definition.value: Person or organisation who collected the specimen

short.value: The period or date and time of specimen collection.

definition.value: The period or date and time of specimen collection.

short.value: The quantity of specimen collected

definition.value: The quantity of specimen collected

short.value: If relevant for the results, the method of obtaining the specimen.

definition.value: If relevant for the results, the method of obtaining the specimen.

short.value: Device used to perform specimen collection

definition.value: Device used to perform specimen collection

short.value: Anatomic location (e.g. body location, laterality and other details) where the material is collected, e.g. Elbow, left

definition.value: Anatomic location (e.g. body location, laterality and other details) where the material is collected, e.g. Elbow, left

short.value: Date and time when specimen is received by the testing laboratory.

definition.value: Date and time when specimen is received by the testing laboratory.

short.value: The container holding the specimen.

definition.value: The container holding the specimen.

short.value: Quantity of specimen within container

definition.value: Quantity of specimen within container

short.value: The device resource for the the container holding the specimen.

definition.value: The device resource for the the container holding the specimen.

short.value: State of the specimen. State of the speeimen should be alligned with dataAbsentReason element of the Observatiom model.

definition.value: State of the specimen. State of the speeimen should be alligned with dataAbsentReason element of the Observatiom model.

short.value: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

definition.value: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).
